title: Trigonometric Values - angle in standard position

content.question:
All coordinates are approximate.

The first ray O B starts at the origin and passes through point B at approximately (negative 1.4 comma 1.5).

The second ray O D starts at the origin and passes through point D at approximately (2.2 comma 1.5).

The third ray O C is the positive x axis and starts at the origin and passes through point C at approximately (2.8 comma 0).

​The figure gives four points and some corresponding rays in the <math alttext="x y"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-plane. Which of the following is true?

choices.label: ​​Angle <math alttext="C O B"><semantics><mrow><mi>C</mi><mi>O</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is in standard position with initial ray <math alttext="O B"><semantics><mrow><mi>O</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and terminal ray <math alttext="O C"><semantics><mrow><mi>O</mi><mi>C</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

​​Angle <math alttext="C O B"><semantics><mrow><mi>C</mi><mi>O</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is in standard position with initial ray <math alttext="O C"><semantics><mrow><mi>O</mi><mi>C</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and terminal ray <math alttext="O B"><semantics><mrow><mi>O</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

​​Angle <math alttext="D O B"><semantics><mrow><mi>D</mi><mi>O</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is in standard position with initial ray <math alttext="O B"><semantics><mrow><mi>O</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and terminal ray <math alttext="O D"><semantics><mrow><mi>O</mi><mi>D</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

​​Angle <math alttext="D O B"><semantics><mrow><mi>D</mi><mi>O</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is in standard position with initial ray <math alttext="O D"><semantics><mrow><mi>O</mi><mi>D</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and terminal ray <math alttext="O B"><semantics><mrow><mi>O</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

content.answer: ​​Angle <math alttext="C O B"><semantics><mrow><mi>C</mi><mi>O</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is in standard position with initial ray <math alttext="O C"><semantics><mrow><mi>O</mi><mi>C</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and terminal ray <math alttext="O B"><semantics><mrow><mi>O</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
